Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Arrival \Ar*riv"al\, n. [From {Arrive}.] 1. The act of arriving, or coming; the act of reaching a place from a distance, whether by water (as in its original sense) or by land. [1913 Webster]
Our watchmen from the towers, with longing eyes, Expect his swift arrival. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
2. The attainment or reaching of any object, by effort, or in natural course; as, our arrival at this conclusion was wholly unexpected. [1913 Webster]
3. The person or thing arriving or which has arrived; as, news brought by the last arrival. [1913 Webster]
Another arrival still more important was speedily announced. --Macaulay. [1913 Webster]
4. An approach. [Obs.] [1913 Webster]
The house has a corner arrival. --H. Walpole. [1913 Webster]
arrival n 1: accomplishment of an objective [syn: {reaching}] 2: the act of arriving at a certain place; "they awaited her arrival" 3: someone who arrives (or has arrived) [syn: {arriver}, {comer}]
